channel.title: Stabalizing my Server(SG v9)
channel.description:
okay well im using Czar Base (cleaned)
but ive edited a lot... now i just need to make it more stable...
its been lagging lately n stuff.... drops turn off...
any1 help me? i need help doing a tutorial (i need lots of help with the thread per client tut) drops turn off after a while, i need help fixing that...
if u can help either...
pm me add my msn (g_a_r_z_a@live.com) or post a reply
REP TO ANY1 THAT CAN HELP
ps: if u can think of anything else that would make it more stable, please dont be shy and tell me (if its a tutorial, post link 2 it)

[code]That removes the notify() function (threaded leftover).

That will send call the function to send outgoing packets.

This is so the IOClient class can set the in and out variables.

If you wish (not crucial - but clears the clutter):

Remove your run() method in the client class.

Remove implements Runnable so the declaration looks like this:[/code]

item.title: Stabalizing my Server(SG v9)
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:30, topic:262207”]ok im on this step… it looks a lil dif tho…

IN THE TUTORIAL:

[code]Replace your newPlayerClient method with this:

Code:

// a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom)
{
	IOClient ioc;
	try {
		ioc = new IOClient(s, connectedFrom);
		ioc.handler = this;
	} catch(Exception e) { return; }
	synchronized(add) {
		add.add(ioc);
	}
}

That will instead create an IOClient and add it to the add queue.
Now we are going to add a new method to process IOClients.[/code]

and in my file it looks like this… how wuld i replace it?

[code] // a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom) {
// first, search for a free slot
//int slot = -1, i = playerSlotSearchStart;
int slot = -1, i = 1;
do {
if(players[i] == null) {
slot = i;
break;
}
i++;
if(i >= maxPlayers) i = 0; // wrap around
// } while(i != playerSlotSearchStart);
} while(i <= maxPlayers);

	client newClient = new client(s, slot);
	newClient.handler = this;
	(new Thread(newClient)).start();
	if(slot == -1) return;		// no free slot found - world is full
	players[slot] = newClient;
	players[slot].connectedFrom = connectedFrom;
            updatePlayerNames();[/code]

shuld it be this?

[code] // a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom)
{
IOClient ioc;
try {
ioc = new IOClient(s, connectedFrom);
ioc.handler = this;
} catch(Exception e) { return; }
synchronized(add) {
add.add(ioc);
}
} while(i <= maxPlayers);

	client newClient = new client(s, slot);
	newClient.handler = this;
	(new Thread(newClient)).start();
	if(slot == -1) return;		// no free slot found - world is full
	players[slot] = newClient;
	players[slot].connectedFrom = connectedFrom;
            updatePlayerNames();[/code][/quote]

You would just highlight the entire newPlayerClient method and replaced it with the one provided.

Read full topic

item.title: Stabalizing my Server(SG v9)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

ok im on this step… it looks a lil dif tho…

IN THE TUTORIAL:

[code]Replace your newPlayerClient method with this:

Code:

// a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom)
{
	IOClient ioc;
	try {
		ioc = new IOClient(s, connectedFrom);
		ioc.handler = this;
	} catch(Exception e) { return; }
	synchronized(add) {
		add.add(ioc);
	}
}

That will instead create an IOClient and add it to the add queue.
Now we are going to add a new method to process IOClients.[/code]

and in my file it looks like this… how wuld i replace it?

[code] // a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom) {
// first, search for a free slot
//int slot = -1, i = playerSlotSearchStart;
int slot = -1, i = 1;
do {
if(players[i] == null) {
slot = i;
break;
}
i++;
if(i >= maxPlayers) i = 0; // wrap around
// } while(i != playerSlotSearchStart);
} while(i <= maxPlayers);

	client newClient = new client(s, slot);
	newClient.handler = this;
	(new Thread(newClient)).start();
	if(slot == -1) return;		// no free slot found - world is full
	players[slot] = newClient;
	players[slot].connectedFrom = connectedFrom;
            updatePlayerNames();[/code]

shuld it be this?

[code] // a new client connected
public void newPlayerClient(java.net.Socket s, String connectedFrom)
{
IOClient ioc;
try {
ioc = new IOClient(s, connectedFrom);
ioc.handler = this;
} catch(Exception e) { return; }
synchronized(add) {
add.add(ioc);
}
} while(i <= maxPlayers);

	client newClient = new client(s, slot);
	newClient.handler = this;
	(new Thread(newClient)).start();
	if(slot == -1) return;		// no free slot found - world is full
	players[slot] = newClient;
	players[slot].connectedFrom = connectedFrom;
            updatePlayerNames();[/code]

item.title: Stabalizing my Server(SG v9)
item.dc:creator: @Reforced _Reforced
item.description:
@Reforced wrote:

[quote=“The Reaper X, post:15, topic:262207”][quote author=silabgarza link=topic=346285.msg2667929#msg2667929 date=1234671053]
pss: repped reaper for trying
[/quote]Cool, now i know i have over 200 rep. Lets party.

Try getting the client class down a little more, remove unneeded log files, etc. There’s a few things on there that really aren’t needed at all.[/quote]

To be honest removing things from your client class really doesn’t do much except lets you find things easier, organization. Enless you are removing from your process, then that should help you somewhat. Though it is strange Project Czar uses two processes, the boolean and the method.

[quote=“silabgarza, post:14, topic:262207”]eh il try googling it i guess…

ANYONE WANNA TRY DOING THE REMOVE THREAD PER CLIENT TUTORIAL FOR ME?

ps: any1 got more ideas?
pss: repped reaper for trying[/quote]

Really it shouldn’t be a challenge to do that tutorial, stormcutter made it simple.
